column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=DS : But you 've never thought about how -- if you could choose how you 'd prefer to die ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=No , that 's --
#Text=DS :
#Text=It seems like such a basic human thing to contemplate , one 's mortality .
#Text=I mean , I believe you , but --
#Text=SB :
#Text=I 've contemplated my mortality a lot .
#Text=Because I had melanoma eleven years ago , and I thought a long time about my mortality .
#Text=But what it did to me , it did n't make me think about how I wanted to die ; it made me think about how I was living .
#Text=And I just was n’t happy with how I was living .
#Text=DS : What were n't you happy with ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=I was too selfish ; I was too ambition -driven .
#Text=I was not paying near the attention to my family that I should have been .
#Text=I was more interested in climbing the ladder , rather than helping people .
#Text=And it really came around to me that if I were to die with this , I would n't have been happy with how I 'd lived my life .
#Text=And it just -- it made my faith much stronger ; it radically changed me , in looking at that .
#Text=DS : That was your --
#Text=SB :
#Text=I still get it wrong a lot .
#Text=I am nowhere , anywhere near perfect .
#Text=I am a sinful , fallen man , but my faith really drives me much more now , and I do a lot of things that before , I would n't have done .
#Text=And I 'm much happier with my life now than before that episode .
#Text=DS : Was that your impetus to run for the Senate ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=No , but it did shape me , because it was just ahead of that run for the Senate that that episode happened .
#Text=DS :
#Text=What trait do you deplore in other people ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=I have too many of my own I deplore ; it 's hard for me to pick on somebody else .
#Text=DS : Oh ...
#Text=SB :
#Text=I get judgmental quickly .
#Text=I do n't see , as I should , the image of God as much in others as I really want to .
#Text=They 're not traits in others that I deplore ; it 's ones in myself .
#Text=On environmentalism and energy
#Text=DS : Do you believe that a good Christian should also be a good environmentalist ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=Yes .
#Text=DS : How so ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=Well , we 're given the planet and given dominion over it , and I believe we should be good stewards of that .
#Text=Now , the question becomes how do you do that , but I think the admonition to do that is God 's creation , and we 're the stewards of it .
#Text=I think we clearly should be .
#Text=DS :
#Text=And you do n’t think that Arctic drilling contradicts that notion ?
#Text=SB :
#Text=I do n't think the ANWR drilling has been proscribed .
#Text=We 're talking about drilling in an area -- I think the size is about ten miles by ten miles in an area that 's the size of South Carolina .

#Text=We do need resources to be able to continue to run -- that our dependency on foreign oil generally favors some people who are -- who do a lot of pretty bad things , out of Iran , or Venezuela , and that if we were less dependent upon that they would have less chance of doing some of the things they 're doing .
#Text=To me , I think you 've got to look at it in a balance…I 'd love to see us using a lot more electricity in our car fleet , reduce our dependence on oil drastically .
